question: Is there truth in the statement that Imaam Muhammad (RH) is alleged to have said "If my companion (Imaam Abu Hanifah [RH]) knew what I know now, he would have changed two thirds of his Madh-hab"
answer:
QUESTION

Is there truth in the statement that Imaam Muhammad (RH) is alleged to have said "If my companion (Imaam Abu Hanifah [RH]) knew what I know now, he would have changed two thirds of his Madh-hab"

1) Is this statement authentic? Could you please give reference.

2) Is there any truth in this statement of Imaam Muhammad (RH)?

ANSWER


Share:

In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful


Assalaamu `alaykum waRahmatullahi Wabarakatuh

 

We are not aware of any such statement.  Whoever has ascribed this statement to Imām Muhammad rehamatullah alayh should provide a reference for it.  Thereafter, we will analyze the authenticity of it.  But, until they provide a reference and we, subsequently, analyze and confirm its authenticity, this statement cannot be accepted as an authentic statement of Imām Muhammad rehamatullah alayh.

And Allah knows best

Wassalaamu `alaykum

Ml. Abrar Mirza,
Student Darul Iftaa
